The probability of the product being high quality is about 33.33%, with a value of $300. The probability of it being low quality is 66.67%, with a value of $0. This results in an expected value calculation:

Expected value = (0.3333 * $300) + (0.6667 * $0) = $99.99

The expected value ($99.99) is approximately equal to the cost of the product ($100), making this a slightly negative expected outcome when considering rounding and transaction costs, along with the absence of observed high-quality product sales so far. Based on this calculation:

```json
{"decision": "no"}
```
